abstract: For a non-relativistic scale invariant system in two spatial dimensions, the quantum scattering amplitude $f(θ)$ is given as a dispersion relation, with a simple closed form for ${\rm Im}(f(θ)$) as well as the integrated cross-section $σ\propto {\rm Im}(f(θ=0))$. For fixed $θ\neq 0$, the classical limit is straightforward to obtain.
